task: Look up the definition and both UK and US pronunciation of the word \"reverie,\" and provide an example sentence using the word from Cambridge Dictionary.
Look up the definition and both UK and US pronunciation of the word \"reverie,\" and provide an example sentence using the word from Cambridge Dictionary.
user_action_and_explanation: type "reverie" into the search bar with placeholder text 'Search English—Chinese (Traditional)' and press Enter to look up the word's definition and pronunciation.
observation: The user has successfully located the definition and pronunciations for the word "reverie" in the Cambridge Dictionary. According to the screenshot, "reverie" is defined as "a state of having pleasant dream-like thoughts." The pronunciation in the UK is /ˈrev.ər.i/ and in the US is /ˈrev.ə.ri/. Additionally, an example sentence provided is: "He was lost in reverie until he suddenly heard someone behind him." Furthermore, numerous example sentences using the word "reverie" are listed, such as "His reverie, however, was short-lived." and "Laureline breaks him from his reverie and elects to bring him exploring to take his mind off things."
